parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From sun and bouleuo; to give advice jointly, i.e. Recommend, deliberate or determine.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
To buy. From agora; properly, to go to market, i.e. to purchase; specially, to redeem.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A piece of gold, golden ornament. Diminutive of chrusos; a golden article, i.e. Gold plating, ornament, or coin.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: From pur; to kindle, i.e. to be ignited, glow, be refined, or to be inflamed.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Fire; the heat of the sun, lightning; fig: strife, trials; the eternal fire. A primary word; 'fire'.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To become rich, be rich, abound in. From ploutizo; to be wealthy.
White, bright, brilliant. From luke; white.
A long flowing outer garment, tunic. Neuter of a presumed derivative of ennumi; a dress.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From peri and ballo; to throw all around, i.e. Invest.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Shame, shamefacedness, shameful deeds. From aischunomai; shame or disgrace.
Nakedness. From gumnos; nudity.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To make clear (visible, manifest), make known. From phaneros; to render apparent.
And, even, also, namely.
Eye-salve. Neuter of a presumed derivative of kollura; properly, a poultice, i.e. a plaster.
To rub in, anoint. From en and chrio; to rub in, i.e. Besmear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
The eye; fig: the mind's eye. From optanomai; the eye; by implication, vision; figuratively, envy.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (primarily physical), I look, see, perceive, discern. A primary verb; to look at.
